label: Introduction to Energy Sources
description: Explanation of energy technologies using an elementary approach presupposing no prior scientific or technical background. Coverage of all energy sources including fossil fueled, solar, hydro, and nuclear power. Integral demonstrations and a tour of the University's power plant. Discussion of energy related incidents with emphasis on environmental, economic, and social impact. Credit is not given for both GCL 101 and NPRE 101. Prerequisite: Restricted to first-year freshmen and transfer students.
courseSectionInformation: Credit is not given for both GCL 101 and NPRE 101. Prerequisite: Restricted to first-year freshmen and transfer students.
sectionDegreeAttributes: Grand Challenge-Sustainability, Physical Sciences, and Quant Reasoning II course.
sectionCappArea: Restricted to First Time Freshman or Transfer student - first time students.
